Experience the Tsitsikamma Mountains

About the Race

The Ultimate Trail Experience

The Tsitsikamma Ultra is a challenging 50km trail run that takes you through some of South Africa's most spectacular indigenous forests, coastal paths, and mountain trails. This is not just a raceâ€”it's an adventure that will test your limits while showcasing the breathtaking beauty of the Garden Route.

Starting at Storms River Petropoort, the route winds through ancient forests, crosses streams, and offers stunning mountain vistas before finishing at Covie. With a total elevation gain of 2,500m, this ultra demands respect, preparation, and determination.

The Route

Elevation Profile

Distance 50km
Elevation Gain 2,500m
Cut-off Time 12 hours
Aid Stations 2

Our Sponsors

Frequently Asked Questions

The official cut-off time is 16 hours from the start. There are intermediate cut-offs at major checkpoints to ensure runner safety and race logistics.

The route includes single track trails, coastal paths, forest boardwalks, river crossings, and some road sections. Expect technical terrain with roots, rocks, and varying surface conditions.

Yes, mandatory gear includes: emergency blanket, whistle, headlamp with spare batteries, first aid supplies, and minimum 1L water capacity. Full gear list provided upon registration.

There are 8 fully stocked aid stations positioned approximately every 12-15km along the route. Each provides water, sports drinks, food, and basic medical support.

Pacers are allowed from the 50km mark onwards. Support crews can access designated areas only. All pacers must register and pay a small fee for race insurance.

Entry includes: race bib and timing chip, finisher medal and t-shirt, post-race meal, aid station support, medical coverage, and shuttle transport to the start line.

We have partnerships with local lodges and guesthouses offering special rates for participants. Camping options are also available. Book early as accommodation fills up quickly.
